rdf:Description.dc:description: ORDER OF EXERCISES, INVOCATION . M U S I C :-Instrumental Quartette. ECONOMY OF LABOR, PHYSICAL DETERIORATION, JOHN L. STEVENS, Benton County. C. L. SUKSDORF, Scott County. *COAL AND THE COAL-FIELDS OF IOWA, *POLITICS, EXCHANGE AS A CIVILIZER, H. L. PAGE , Boone County. C. H. TILLOTSON, Story County. P . S. BROWN, Fayette County. MUSIC :--Chorus, "Far Away the Camp Fires Burn." ENCOURAGE THE BEAUTIFUL, SCIENCE AND FAITH, EDUCATION NEVER COMPLETED, CLIMATIC INFLUENCE, J. C. ARTHUR, Floyd County. C. P. WELLMAN, Winnebago County. H. FULLER, Wapello County. G. W. RAMSEY. Buchanan County. M U S I C :-- Instrumental Duett. OUR OWN LITERATURE, E. M. HUNGERFORD, Wapello County. SCIENTIFIC AGRICULTURE, F. L. HARVEY, Humboldt County. DENOMINATIONAL CHRISTIANITY, FANNIE H. RICHARDS. Hamilton County. MUSIC :-Song, " 'Tis But a Little Faded Flower." HOW TO BUILD A STATE, L. W. NOYES. Linn County. NECESSITY AND BENEFITS OF MILITARY DISTINCT ION S. A. CHURCHILL, Scott County. *DOMESTIC ARCHITECTUR E . THE PRIDE OF SCHOLARSHIP. J. M. WELLS, Story County . I. W . SMITH. Floyd County . M U S I C :-Instrumental Solo. SELF-GOVERNMENT THE HIGHEST WISDOM. L. FOSTER, Wapello County. THE PNYX AND ITS LESSONS, T. L. THOMPSON. Fayette County. JOURNALISM, C. A. SMITH, Clinton County. MUSIC :- Il Bacio. *BRAIN AND MUSCLE. C. N. DEITZ, Jones Count y. FAILURE, THE LAW OF PROGRESS, O. CESSNA, Story County. THE NATIONAL BANKING SYSTEM OF THE UNITED STATES-- EDUCATION FOR WOMEN, - H. C. SPENCER, Poweshiek County. MATTIE A. LOCKE , Benton County . MUSIC :-Duet, " Listen to the Wood Bird's Song." THE AGES, E. W. STANTON, Story County. THE OLD AND NEW, S. H . DI CKEY , Henry County. CULTURE, THE SHOWY AND THE SOLID , J. K. MACOMBER. Cass County. MUSIC :- Duet for two pianos. Presentation of Diplomas . MUSIC :-Parting Song. BENEDICTION. *Excused from Speaking. No distinction conferred in the assignment of places.

Additional photographs of commencement can be found in the University Archives Photograph Collection. Commencement programs are not official graduation records. Additional photographs of commencement can be found in the University Archives Photograph Collection. Commencement programs are not official graduation records. rdf:Description.dc:coverage: The commencement records of Iowa State University contain commencement programs, addresses, correspondence, invitations, newspaper clippings, photographs, and programs documenting the commencement ceremony at Iowa State University, beginning in 1872 and continuing to the present day. Additional photographs of commencement can be found in the University Archives Photograph Collection. Commencement programs are not official graduation records. For official dates and degrees contact the Iowa State University Registrar's Office (515-294-1840 or registrar@iastate.edu). Story County (Iowa); Iowa (state)

Baccalaureate Sermon; President Chamberlain. SUNDAY, 10th; 7:30 P. M., Farewell Exercises; Young People's Christian Association. MONDAY, 11th; 9, A.M. AND 2, P. M,, Presentation of Orations and Theses before the Trustees. MONDAY, 11th; 7:30, P. M., Literary Exercises of the Alumni Association. TUESDAY, 12th; 2, P.M., . Senior Class-Day Exercises. TUESDAY, 12th; 7, P. M., Address before the Trustees; President D. S. Jordan, Indiana University. TUESDAY, 12th; 8:30, P. M., President's Reception to the Seniors and their Friends, WEDNESDAY, 13th; 10, A, M., Regular Commencement Exercises.

DEERING-A Study of the Magnetic Variation in Story County. G. D. SMITH, FAY I. NICHOLS-Comparative Tests of Pressed Building Brick Commonly Used in Iowa.. DIVISION OF VETERINARY SCIENCE R. R. GLAlSYER DIVISION OF SCIENCE SCIENCE D. J. SCHOLTEN-The Era of Augustus Caesar. R. B. SWIFT GENERAL AND DOMESTIC SCIENCE LUCY GRIFFIN-A Study of the Bacteria of the Air. Owing to change of college year, there are two sections of this year's graduating class. The class for the college year numbers eighty; sixty graduated last November and the remainder comprise the present section. The present section took an extra half year's work of thrir own choice.

rdf:Description.dc:coverage: The commencement records of Iowa State University contain commencement programs, addresses, correspondence, invitations, newspaper clippings, photographs, and programs documenting the commencement ceremony at Iowa State University, beginning in 1872 and continuing to the present day. Additional photographs of commencement can be found in the University Archives Photograph Collection. Commencement programs are not official graduation records. For official dates and degrees contact the Iowa State University Registrar's Office (515-294-1840 or registrar@iastate.edu). Story County (Iowa); Iowa (state)

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 8
rdf:Description.dc:description: ~~~~PROGRAM~~~~ FOR COMMENCEMENT WEEK THURSDAY, JUNE 2 7:30 P.M. Peace Pipe. FRIDAY, JUNE 3 3:00 P.M. Base Ball: Ames vs. Grinnell. 8:15 P.M. Society Graduation. SATURDAY, JUNE 4 7:30 P.M. Senior Breakfast. 3:00 P.M. Base Ball: Professors vs. Seniors. 8:15 P.M. Term Recital. SUNDAY, JUNE 5 10:30 A.M. Baccalaureate Address. MONDAY, JUNE 6 9:30 A.M. Band Concert. 10:30 A.M. Exhibition Drill by Special Company. 2:30 P.M. Inauguration of President Storms. 8:15 P.M. "The Merchant of Venice," presented by the Junior Class.

rdf:Description.dc:coverage: The commencement records of Iowa State University contain commencement programs, addresses, correspondence, invitations, newspaper clippings, photographs, and programs documenting the commencement ceremony at Iowa State University, beginning in 1872 and continuing to the present day. Additional photographs of commencement can be found in the University Archives Photograph Collection. Commencement programs are not official graduation records. For official dates and degrees contact the Iowa State University Registrar's Office (515-294-1840 or registrar@iastate.edu). Story County (Iowa); Iowa (state)

rdf:Description.dc:description: Program. Thursday, May 31 8:00 p. m. Peace Pipe Friday, June 1 7:30 p. m Society Graduation Saturday, June 2 8:00 p. m. Term Recital Sunday, June 3 10:30 a. m. Baccalaureate Sermon 8:00 p.m. Address before Y.M. and Y.W.C.A. Monday, June 4 3:00 p. m. Senior-Faculty Ball Game 8:00 p. m. Junior Class Play Tuesday, June 5 10:00 a. m. Cardinal Guild 2:30 p. m. Class Day Program 8:00 p· m. Grand Concert Wednesday, June 6 "Sun Up" Senior Breakfast 10:00 a. m. Alumni Business Meeting 2:30 p. m. Association Jubilee "Twilight" Promenade Concert 8:00 p. m. Alumni Reception at Central Building Thursday, June 7 10:00 a. m. Dedication of Central Building 11:00 a. m. Commencement Exercises. Address by Dr. Frank W. Gunsaulus 1:00 p. m. Alumni-Faculty Dinner

rdf:Description.dc:title: Annual commencement of the class of 1906 and dedication of the Central Building, Iowa State College of Agriculture and Mechanic Arts, 1906
rdf:Description.dc:creator: Iowa State University. Office of the Registrar
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Commencement ceremonies; Programs; Iowa State Agricultural College; Iowa State University; Invitation cards 1900s;
rdf:Description.dc:description: Includes commencement program, invitation and list of commencement week activities, held May 31st -June 7th, 1906. One sheet folded into fourths and one invitation card.
rdf:Description.dc:publisher: Iowa State University Library Special Collections and University Archives; http://archives.lib.iastate.edu/
rdf:Description.dc:format: 7 pages; 2 sheets programs (documents); invitations image pdf
rdf:Description.dc:relation: Iowa State University, Office of the Registrar, Commencement Records, 1872-[ongoing], http://findingaids.lib.iastate.edu/spcl/arch/rgrp/7-9-4.html LD2547-I68x_CommencementProgram_1906-06.pdf
rdf:Description.dc:coverage: The commencement records of Iowa State University contain commencement programs, addresses, correspondence, invitations, newspaper clippings, photographs, and programs documenting the commencement ceremony at Iowa State University, beginning in 1872 and continuing to the present day. Additional photographs of commencement can be found in the University Archives Photograph Collection. Commencement programs are not official graduation records. For official dates and degrees contact the Iowa State University Registrar's Office (515-294-1840 or registrar@iastate.edu). Story County (Iowa); Iowa (state)

rdf:Description.dc:title: Annual commencement of the class of 1907 and laying of the corner-stone of the New Agricultural Hall, Iowa State College of Agriculture and Mechanic Arts, 1907
rdf:Description.dc:creator: Iowa State University. Office of the Registrar
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Commencement ceremonies; Programs; Iowa State Agricultural College; Iowa State University; 1900s;
rdf:Description.dc:description: Includes commencement program, held June 6th, 1907. One sheet folded into fourths.
rdf:Description.dc:publisher: Iowa State University Library Special Collections and University Archives; http://archives.lib.iastate.edu/
rdf:Description.dc:relation: Iowa State University, Office of the Registrar, Commencement Records, 1872-[ongoing], http://findingaids.lib.iastate.edu/spcl/arch/rgrp/7-9-4.html LD2547-I68x_CommencementProgram_1907-06.pdf
rdf:Description.dc:coverage: The commencement records of Iowa State University contain commencement programs, addresses, correspondence, invitations, newspaper clippings, photographs, and programs documenting the commencement ceremony at Iowa State University, beginning in 1872 and continuing to the present day. Additional photographs of commencement can be found in the University Archives Photograph Collection. Commencement programs are not official graduation records. For official dates and degrees contact the Iowa State University Registrar's Office (515-294-1840 or registrar@iastate.edu). Story County (Iowa); Iowa (state)
